channel.title: Non classé Archives - Régis Royer - Sound Designer

item.title: Gumgum Cup – Party Game
item.dc:creator: Régis Royer
item.description:
Gumgum Cup PC party game on UE4 Gumgum Cup is a local multiplayer video game project, developed in Unreal Engine 4.27 for PC. The game focuses on the physical manipulation of bubble gums. Chew to recharge, bounce on gum strings,...

The post Gumgum Cup – Party Game appeared first on Régis Royer - Sound Designer.
item.content:encoded:
Gumgum Cup

PC party game on UE4

Gumgum Cup is a local multiplayer video game project, developed in Unreal Engine 4.27 for PC. The game focuses on the physical manipulation of bubble gums. Chew to recharge, bounce on gum strings, or protect yourself with bubbles. Use every chewing gum state to your advantage to eliminate your opponents!

The project was carried out by a complete development team, including 2D/3D artists, game designers, programmers, and producers. I served as the sole sound designer and music composer for the project. My responsibilities included implementing sound assets using Wwise and integrating most sounds through Unreal Engine’s Blueprints.

I also managed the recording sessions for character voices and announcement voices, in addition to cleaning the samples afterward. To create chewing gum sounds, I crafted props to generate the necessary sound materials, such as slime, melted candies, balloons and oobleck.

I composed the entire original soundtrack for the game, drawing inspiration from 1980s Japanese fusion bands like Casiopea and Dimension to create a musical universe that aligned with the game’s vibrant and colorful artistic direction.

The biggest challenge of this project was managing the mix for a local multiplayer party game, which required careful consideration of which sounds were most important for user feedback.

To prioritize these sounds, I utilized specific buses in Wwise, allowing critical sounds to duck other sound effects and the music, ensuring they stood out. It was also essential to give depth to the four characters, making their voices distinct from one another. This was achieved by choosing clearly identifiable voice acting for each character.

Finally, the interactive music system relies on layering: we have a base music layer for each round, and when a character takes first place, they activate their unique music layers. A solo layer is attached to the player, tracking their position to better indicate where the leader is, in addition to the crown they wear.

The integration of all these details made the game’s audio clear and coherent, even amidst the dense and chaotic nature of each match.

Overall, this experience was incredibly enriching from both a human and technical perspective.

You can download the PC build in the following link:

https://isart-digital.itch.io/gumgumcup

Back

The post Gumgum Cup – Party Game appeared first on Régis Royer - Sound Designer.

item.title: Water Soundbank
item.dc:creator: Régis Royer
item.description:
Water Sounds free soundbank released on 99sounds Water Sounds is a free collection of ocean sounds, river sounds, and water stream sounds. I recorded these water sounds during a road trip around Iceland in 2021. I used a Zoom H5...

The post Water Soundbank appeared first on Régis Royer - Sound Designer.
item.content:encoded:
Water Sounds

free soundbank released on 99sounds

Water Sounds is a free collection of ocean sounds, river sounds, and water stream sounds. I recorded these water sounds during a road trip around Iceland in 2021. I used a Zoom H5 and a couple of Line Audio CM3 microphones, ORTF configuration, with Rycote Baby Ball windscreen.

My goal was to provide users with water sounds that can loop seamlessly to create long water ambiances.

The library includes 45 water loops with perfect start and endpoints. The sounds are provided in 48kHz, 24 bits, stereo WAV format. The total runtime is 40 minutes.

The included sounds are UCS-compliant and have embedded metadata.

Through this project, I explored field recording and learned about the challenges associated with capturing sound in outdoor environments. I gained insights into the UCS standard, discovered how to effectively organize and sort samples, and learned how to create metadata for proper categorization. I developed an efficient workflow using Reaper that streamlined the entire process.

You can find the download link for the sample pack here:

https://99sounds.org/water-sounds/

Back

The post Water Soundbank appeared first on Régis Royer - Sound Designer.

item.title: Caedes – Animated Short Movie
item.dc:creator: Régis Royer
item.description:
Caedes Short Animated Movie Caedes is a short film created by students from ISART Digital. It is a psychodrama in which Halley, a maintenance worker at a wind turbine facility, is tormented by the accidental death of a colleague. Notably,...

The post Caedes – Animated Short Movie appeared first on Régis Royer - Sound Designer.
item.content:encoded:
Caedes

Short Animated Movie

Caedes is a short film created by students from ISART Digital. It is a psychodrama in which Halley, a maintenance worker at a wind turbine facility, is tormented by the accidental death of a colleague. Notably, the film features no dialogue. Sound plays a pivotal role in shaping the narrative and conveying the main character’s psychological distress.

The team consisted of 4 animation artists and 4 sound designers.

I led the audio team for this project, coordinating with the film team to establish a coherent artistic vision. I managed the audio production process, assigning tasks and ensuring smooth collaboration within the audio department. I also produced all the foley work, including breathing sounds, and handled the complete sound mix for the film.

Through this project, I gained valuable experience working closely with the film team, reviewing each scene in detail to align sound design with the visuals. This tight collaboration required a lot of teamwork and adaptability to achieve the desired emotional tone. I also developed strong skills in mixing, balancing the different elements of the sound assets to enhance the overall impact of the film.

Back

The post Caedes – Animated Short Movie appeared first on Régis Royer - Sound Designer.

item.title: Miw’s Legacy – 2D Platformer
item.dc:creator: Régis Royer
item.description:
Miw’s Legacy Student 2D platformer game in Unity Miw’s Legacy is a student-led video game project developed in Unity for PC. Miw is a cat brought back to life by the goddess Bastet to retrieve the scrolls needed to free...

The post Miw’s Legacy – 2D Platformer appeared first on Régis Royer - Sound Designer.
item.content:encoded:
Miw's Legacy

Student 2D platformer game in Unity

Miw’s Legacy is a student-led video game project developed in Unity for PC. Miw is a cat brought back to life by the goddess Bastet to retrieve the scrolls needed to free her.

The team consists of 7 game artists, 3 programmers, and 2 sound designers.

I was responsible for creating all ambient sounds and sound effects for the game, as well as coordinating the overall audio mix.
In addition, I handled the audio implementation using FMOD.

For version control, we relied on Git, which proved invaluable when we encountered a critical bug during the build process.
By tracing the problematic commit, we were able to revert the changes and restore stability for the final deliverable.

It was a personal challenge for me, as I joined the team just two weeks before the final submission, but I successfully completed all remaining sound-related tasks.

I learned a lot about Unity, FMOD, and Git on this project, as well as working as part of a team with other disciplines in a video game development.

You can download the PC build in the following link:

https://regisroyer.itch.io/miws-legacy

Back

The post Miw’s Legacy – 2D Platformer appeared first on Régis Royer - Sound Designer.
